alert.note: Alert for Macomb (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 11:57PM EDT until August 25 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... North Branch Clinton Near Mt Clemens affecting Macomb County. .Heavy rainfall across the headwaters of the North Branch of the Clinton River is causing the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Branch Clinton Near Mt Clemens. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 15.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Impact...At 15.0 feet, Agricultural land along the river begins to flood. When the river reaches this level due to rain, the Middle Branch Clinton River usually is flooding in some locations. The middle branch will crest about 24 hours earlier than the north branch. 21 and 22 Mile Roads may be flooded. Water could also reach the foundation of a few homes along the bank of the middle branch by Heyndrich and Cass Avenue. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
